End Event
The End Event is used to complete the business process (BP) instance.
To choose the End Event type, click the
button on the Event action panel. The types of the End Events are similar to those of the Intermediate Throw Event (for more information, refer to the
Intermediate Throw Event
).
The End Event parameters:
where:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Displaying the item name.
Identifier
Displaying the item ID (it is recorded automatically the first time the profile is saved).
Process
Displaying the name of the business process in which the item is used.
Event type
Displaying the name of the item event type.
Process instance completed
Displaying whether a process instance has been completed. Default value: No. In the case of branching and parallel execution of BP stages, when the BP object reaches the specified stage, the process ends on all BP branches (that is, both on the current and on the parallel).
Object status
Choosing the object status from the System directory. The object will get a custom status when moving to a BP, upon transition to this stage.
Task interrupted
Indicating whether the task has been interrupted: No. Setting the behavior of end processes for subprocesses. In case when subprocesses move to the end event, if the value "Yes" is on (when working with other types of the end process), the transition to the main route will not occur.
Process stage
Displaying the name of the business process stage.
